translations.pages/[languageId]/story/firstMeet: Our story began in 2017, when we first met through common friends in the lovely city of Turku. At the time, Viktoriia had just returned from her student exchange semester in Slovenia, juggling between an internship and her master thesis, and Victor had just moved to the city, pursuing his PhD degree after an unforgettable student exchange the previous year.
translations.pages/[languageId]/story/fallingInLove: We began to hang out in the company of common friends, and soon enough the harsh dark Finnish autumn and winter seasons also did their part in bringing us closer together. After endless sessions of "Settlers of Catan" and other board games, we ended up talking more and finding more things in common, exchanging "Friends" quotes and references, until, eventually, sometime in April, we went on our first date together. And this is how Vappu, or the 1st of May, has become also our very own reason of celebration - the anniversary of us!
translations.pages/[languageId]/story/lifeTogether: The time moved quickly afterwards, in our own little corner of life, spending time together at home or travelling together far and wide! A lot of things happened, from new jobs to graduations, from internships abroad to world pandemics and war. It was a time of many months spent physically apart, but not in spirit, with almost daily calls, chats, virtual board games, and synchronized streaming. Once the world started breathing more easily once more, we found ourselves picking up right were we left off, and, with a surprise proposal three winters ago, we got engaged!
translations.pages/[languageId]/story/readyForWedding: Now, we are finally ready to celebrate together our wedding day, with friends and family from near and from far, in our dear adoptive Turku and Finland!
translations.pages/[languageId]/schedule/info: The wedding schedule will be available at a later time.
translations.pages/[languageId]/schedule/place: The wedding will take place in the beautiful Airisniemi Manor (Erikvallantie 80), on the peninsula with the same name in the Turku archipelago.
translations.pages/[languageId]/schedule/time: Transportation from the city centre (Turku Cathedral) to the venue will be arranged for the guests at 14:30 and from the venue back to the city centre in the end of the day. The wedding celebration will start at 15:30, with more details to follow.
translations.pages/[languageId]/travel/aboutTurku: Turku is the oldest city in Finland, laying on the coast of the Baltic Sea, in the South-West of the country. The city is relatively large, and quite dynamic, with plenty of things to see and to experience.
translations.pages/[languageId]/travel/getToFinland: There are direct flights between Turku and Riga, Gdansk, and Stockholm, and direct ferry rides between Turku and Stockholm. Alternatively, arriving to Helsinki can also be taken into consideration, as it is close and well-connected to Turku, and its port and airport are much larger and busier.
translations.pages/[languageId]/travel/goAroundFinlan: There are good bus and train connections between Turku and all of the nearby larger cities. Renting a car is also possible, generally requiring only a valid driving license and a credit card.
translations.pages/[languageId]/travel/goAroundTurku: There are many options for local travel in the Turku area. The public transport is fast and reliable, allowing for both single tickets and multi-day passes. Renting bikes or scooters is also possible. Taxi services are highly rated, but generally considered expensive, and while ride-sharing options have recently become available, they are not yet very common.
translations.pages/[languageId]/travel/stayInTurku: There are usually plenty of accommodation options available in Turku. However, the wedding will take place during the same weekend as Ruisrock, a very popular music festival. This will severely affect the availability and prices of accommodation, so it is recommended to book it well in advance! The well-known accommodation-related applications are a good starting point. Alternatively, trying to book directly with the local hotels might lead to a better price, and two hotel chains have also provided booking codes which can be used by the wedding guests.
translations.pages/[languageId]/travel/stayAroundTurk: If there are no suitable Turku-based accommodation options, the nearby towns can be considered as well (e.g., Kaarina, Naantali, Parainen, Raisio, Salo). They are generally well-connected to Turku by local public transport.
translations.pages/[languageId]/travel/welcome: We look forward to welcoming you in Turku!
